scale_notes.trap_slider_direction: 0 = full neutral zone trap, 6 = full forecheck pressure

1-2-2_passive.label: 1-2-2 Passive
1-2-2_passive.description: Safest forecheck. Focuses on structure, limiting odd-man rushes. Best for protecting a lead or when your team is slower than the opponent.
recommended_use: When opponent has dangerous rush offence
When your D-core is weaker or slower

notes: Keep at 1–2 when defending a lead late.
3 is the upper limit before it stops feeling like a real trap.

1-2-2_aggressive.label: 1-2-2 Aggressive
1-2-2_aggressive.description: More pressure on the puck carrier while keeping a 1-2-2 shape. Good when you need more zone time but don’t want full chaos.
recommended_use: Game is tied and you want more O-zone time
Early in games to test opponent breakout
When opponent D struggles under pressure

notes: 4–5 = lean aggressive, good when chasing momentum.

2-3.description: Two forwards in deep with three players across to deny the middle. Good vs teams that attack through the middle lane or love controlled entries.
recommended_use: When opponent attacks through the middle a lot
When you want to slow entries but still pressure low

notes: 2–3 keeps you structured and still dangerous.
Go 4 only if you trust your D gap control.

weak_side_lock.label: Weak Side Lock
weak_side_lock.description: Locks down the weak side and punishes predictable breakouts. Highest aggression profile; best when you read the breakout well or need a major push.
recommended_use: When trailing and need momentum swing
When opponent always exits on the boards or strong side
Short bursts when you feel them rattling

notes: 6 is full send — only in short windows when chasing the game.
If under heavy pressure in your zone, you can even go to trap_slider = 1.
Use this especially in 3rd period when protecting the lead.
Start at 2-3 / trap = 3 as a balanced default.
Move to 1-2-2 Aggressive if you’re not generating enough O-zone time.
Go 1-2-2 Aggressive first; only shift to Weak Side Lock in short bursts.
Trap = 5–6 should be time-limited (e.g., last 5–7 minutes).
Use only when you are okay trading chances against to generate offence.
Best combined with Full Attack on Offensive Strategy.
